place.name: COTGRAVE
place.gazetteerText: COTGRAVE, a village and a parish in Bingham district, Notts. The village stands adjacent to Grantham canal, near the Fosse way, 4 miles S of Ratcliffe r. station, and 7 SE by E of Nottingham; and has a post office under Nottingham. The parish includes also the hamlet of Stragglethorpe. Acres, 3, 350. Real property, £5, 581. Pop., 878. Houses, 193. The property is all in one estate. Some of the inhabitants are stocking-makers. Limestone is found. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £628.*-Patron, Earl Manvers. The church is ancient, has a spire, and is very good. There is a Wesleyan chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
